Use object(s) of this class to set the turndescriptions in all the connections that leads to a node. More...

Detailed Description

Use object(s) of this class to set the turndescriptions in all the connections that leads to a node.

See also:
setTurnDir.dxx

Create an empty object.

This constructor could be used when the setTurnDescriptions-method will be used!

bool SetTurnDescriptions::allNameSame (  OldNode *  toNode  )  [private]
 

Find out if all streetsegments have the same name (the segment where current node is located and all segments where the connections start).

Returns:
True if all street segments have the same name, false otherwise.

Create notice-objects for all connections that leads to the current node.

void SetTurnDescriptions::getLatLon (  GfxData *  gfx,
bool  isNode0,
int32 &  lat1,
int32 &  lon1,
int32 &  lat2,
int32 &  lon2
)  [private]
 

Get the two first or last coordinates in one GdfData.

Parameters:
gfx Pointer to the GfxData
isNode0 Shall the position be set for node0 (first coorinate in gfx) or node1 (last coorinate).
lat1 Outparameter. Set to the first latitude.
lon1 Outparameter. Set to the first longitude.
lat2 Outparameter. Set to the second latitude.
lon2 Outparameter. Set to the second longitude.

bool SetTurnDescriptions::isSymmetricRoundabout (  Vector *  nodeLength,
float64  maxError = 0.25
)  [private]
 

Checks if a 4 way roundabout is symmetric or not.

Parameters:
nodeLength Vector with 4 elements, where each element relates to a entry in the roundabout. Each element should contain the length of the roundabout up that entry. The last element will then have the circumference of the rb.
maxError The error threshold that tells us if the rb is symmetric enough or not. maxError == 0, would mean totally symmetric rb.
Returns:
True if the roundabout was considered symmetric, false otherwise.

void SetTurnDescriptions::reset (  OldMap *  theMap  )  [private]
 

Reset all the member- variables in this object, so that it could be reused to update another node.

Parameters:
theMap The map where the nodes are located.

bool SetTurnDescriptions::setCrossingKind (  OldNode *  toNode,
OldMap *  theMap
) 
 

Sets the crossingkinds for the connections to a specific node.

In case the node is part of a roundabout, all connections leading to and from the roundabout will have their crossingkind set. Note that this method requires that setTurnDescriptions() have been run previously.

Parameters:
toNode The node to set the crossingkind for
theMap The map where toNode is located.
True if the crossingkinds are set properly, false otherwise.

bool SetTurnDescriptions::setTurnDescriptions (  OldNode *  toNode,
OldMap *  theMap
) 
 

Process the connections to a new node.

This method can be used if this object should be reused!

Parameters:
toNode The node to set the connections in.
theMap The nmap where toNode i s located.
Returns:
True if the turndescriptions are set properly, false otherwise.
